<rule id="apm-00000" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <or>
                    <project>
                        <artifact artifactId="{*}applicationinsights{*}" groupId="com.microsoft.azure"/>
                    </project>
                    <file filename="applicationinsights{*}.jar"/>
                </or>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="mandatory" effort="1" title="Application Performance Management (APM) tool - Application Insights">
                    <message>
                        To migrate a Java application that uses Application Insights to Azure, you can follow this recommendation:

                        * **Configure Application Insights**: To connect Application Insights with Java applications deployed on Azure, you can turn on Application Insights in the portal page of your app or configure it through Azure CLI. For a detailed guide, please refer to the following documentation links.
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/configure-language-java#configure-application-insights" title="Configure Application Insights to connect with Azure App Service"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/spring-apps/how-to-application-insights#manage-application-insights-using-the-azure-portal" title="Configure Application Insights to connect with Azure Spring Apps"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/app/app-insights-overview" title="Application Insights"/>
                </hint>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Application Insights</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>
